titles.title: A bill for the relief of Fleurette Seidman.

action.text: Referred to House Committee on The Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Administrative Law and Governmental Relations.
Subcommittee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Forwarded by Subcommittee to Full Committee.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.
Reported to House (Amended) by House Committee on The Judiciary. Report No: 100-443.
Called up by House on Call of Private Calendar.
Received in the Senate and read twice and referred to the Committee on Judiciary.
Referred to Subcommittee on Courts and Administrative Practice.

calendar.text: Committee on Judiciary. Ordered to be reported with an amendment favorably.

action.text: Committee on Judiciary. Reported to Senate by Senator Biden with an amendment. Without written report.

calendar.text: Placed on Senate Legislative Calendar under General Orders. Calendar No. 1107.

vote.text: Passed Senate with an amendment by Voice Vote.

action.text: Message on Senate action sent to the House.

vote.text: House Agreed to Senate Amendments by Voice Vote.

bill.summary: 6/25/1987--Introduced. Directs the Secretary of the Treasury to pay to a named individual a specified sum representing the losses and expenses she incurred arising out of her voluntary termination of Federal employment in good faith reliance on erroneous information regarding her eligibility for a retirement annuity.
